intro: Aulonemiella laegaardii, commonly known as the Laegaard's lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Pilocarpaceae. It is characterized by its crustose thallus, which is tightly adhered to the substrate, typically found on bark or stone. The plant exhibits a pale yellow to orange coloration, with a distinct, granular texture on its surface. It is primarily found in temperate regions, growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized lichen species.
